<div class="articleWide cleared">

        <div id="js-article-text" class="article-text wide">
            <h1>Woman claims she 'cured' skin cancer by BURNING a huge hole in her chest using a controversial 'black salve' natural ointment</h1>
<ul class="mol-bullets-with-font"><li class=""><font style="font-size:1.4em;"><strong>GRAPHIC IMAGE WARNING </strong></font></li><li class=""><font style="font-size:1.4em;"><strong>Brita Hollows claims to have treated a melanoma with black salve ointment</strong></font></li><li class=""><font><strong><span style="font-size: 1.4em;">The 63-year-old from New </span><span style="font-size: 16.8px;">Zealand did not have a biopsy to test melanoma</span></strong></font></li><li class=""><font><strong><span style="font-size: 16.8px;">She documented the changes and effects black salve had on her body</span><span style="font-size: 1.4em;"> </span></strong></font></li><li class=""><font><strong><span style="font-size: 1.4em;">It is illegal to buy  in Australia as it's not a registered therapeutic good</span></strong></font></li><li class=""><font><strong><span style="font-size: 1.4em;">Therapeutic Goods Administration warns black salve can burn skin layers </span></strong></font></li></ul><p class="author-section byline-plain">By

<a href="/home/search.html?s=&authornamef=Emily+Crane+for+Daily+Mail+Australia" class="author" rel="nofollow">Emily Crane for Daily Mail Australia</a>


</p>

</p><div itemprop="articleBody"><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">A woman claims to have cured a melanoma on her chest using a controversial alternative medicine condemned by doctors known as black salve ointment.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">Brita Hollows, from Taupo in New Zealand, opted for the alternate treatment after noticing a freckle on her chest had started to rise and change colour in the centre within the space of two weeks.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">The 63-year-old said she researched the use of black salve and the traditional method of having the melanoma cut out before she started using the ointment made by a herbalist. </font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em"><span class="mol-style-bold">Scroll down for video </span></font></p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-7ed496bcecd45b63" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A5B00000578-3439933-image-a-55_1455076802052.jpg" style="display: none" height="845" width="634" alt="Brita Hollows, from Taupo in New Zealand, opted to use black salve ointment after noticing a freckle on her chest had started to rise and change colour in the centre within the space of two weeks" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    <noscript>
      <img id="i-7ed496bcecd45b63" src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A5B00000578-3439933-image-a-55_1455076802052.jpg" height="845" width="634" alt="Brita Hollows, from Taupo in New Zealand, opted to use black salve ointment after noticing a freckle on her chest had started to rise and change colour in the centre within the space of two weeks" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    </noscript>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">Brita Hollows, from Taupo in New Zealand, opted to use black salve ointment after noticing a freckle on her chest had started to rise and change colour in the centre within the space of two weeks</p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">Ms Hollows did not seek medical advice from a doctor, nor did she have a biopsy to determine if it was a melanoma.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">She documented the changes and effects the black salve had on her body by taking photos over a 12 month period. </font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">The photos have since gone viral on Facebook after Ms Hollows shared them via her healing page Brita Hollows - Conscious Energy. The post was met with a mixed response with some praising her and others condemning her actions due to her lack of medical experience. </font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size: 1.2em">Ms Hollows said her self-diagnosed treatment took about six weeks.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'I'd been in the sea for a bit and had a dressing over it. I figured the salt water couldn't hurt. Every morning in the shower I checked it, took a photo and re-dressed it,' Ms Hollows told Daily Mail Australia. </font></p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-776774d17259f191" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A7700000578-3439933-image-a-56_1455076877168.jpg" style="display: none" height="476" width="634" alt="The 63-year-old took this photo on day three of using black salve. Ms Hollows did not seek medical advice from a doctor, nor did she have a biopsy to determine if it was a melanoma" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    <noscript>
      <img id="i-776774d17259f191" src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A7700000578-3439933-image-a-56_1455076877168.jpg" height="476" width="634" alt="The 63-year-old took this photo on day three of using black salve. Ms Hollows did not seek medical advice from a doctor, nor did she have a biopsy to determine if it was a melanoma" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    </noscript>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">The 63-year-old took this photo on day three of using black salve. Ms Hollows did not seek medical advice from a doctor, nor did she have a biopsy to determine if it was a melanoma</p></div><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-d684e00a0cd7a261" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A8D00000578-3439933-image-a-57_1455076931022.jpg" style="display: none" height="476" width="634" alt="Brita Hollows documented the changes and effects the black salve had on her body by taking photos over a 12 month period. This is towards the beginning when she started using the controversial ointment" class="blkBorder img-share"/>

This is towards the beginning when she started using the controversial ointment" class="blkBorder img-share"/>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">Brita Hollows documented the changes and effects the black salve had on her body by taking photos over a 12 month period. This is towards the beginning when she started using the controversial ointment</p></div><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-6a5f2794dd0cb314" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A6300000578-3439933-image-a-58_1455077017563.jpg" style="display: none" height="476" width="634" alt="The photos have since gone viral on Facebook after Ms Hollows shared them via her. The post was met with a mixed response with some  condemning her actions due to her lack of medical experience" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    <noscript>
      <img id="i-6a5f2794dd0cb314" src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A6300000578-3439933-image-a-58_1455077017563.jpg" height="476" width="634" alt="The photos have since gone viral on Facebook after Ms Hollows shared them via her. The post was met with a mixed response with some  condemning her actions due to her lack of medical experience" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    </noscript>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">The photos have since gone viral on Facebook after Ms Hollows shared them via her. The post was met with a mixed response with some  condemning her actions due to her lack of medical experience</p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'In the instructions it says don't pull it out, just let it fall out to get the roots. I had to wait for that. It was sitting there for three or four days. It came out when I took a dressing off.'</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">Ms Hollows took the last photo documenting the process a few weeks ago to show show her scarring healed and says she is in the all clear.</font></p><div class="art-ins mol-factbox floatRHS news">
                            <h3 class="wocc">
                                <span style="font-weight: bold;">WHAT IS BLACK SALVE? </span></h3><div class="ins cleared xolcc bdrcc"><div class="mol-img-group float-r mol-hidden-caption">    <div class="mol-img" style="height: auto;">
    <img id="i-c88f9ee00d153bc3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2015/09/16/23/2C663EA800000578-3236311-image-a-43_1442444290013.jpg" style="display: none" height="123" width="140" alt="" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    <noscript>
      <img id="i-c88f9ee00d153bc3" src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2015/09/16/23/2C663EA800000578-3236311-image-a-43_1442444290013.jpg" height="123" width="140" alt="" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    </noscript>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption"></p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em;"><span class="mol-style-bold"></span><span class=""><span class="mol-style-bold">Black salve is an 'alternative treatment' for cancer and is also known as red salve, Cansema, or Bloodroot.</span></span><span class="mol-style-bold"></span></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em;"><span class="mol-style-bold"><span class="mol-style-bold">There is no credible or scientific evidence which shows that any black or red salve preparation is effective in treating cancer.</span></span><span class="mol-style-bold"> </span></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em"><span class="mol-style-bold"><span class="mol-style-bold">Both black and red salves are corrosive and essentially burn off layers of the skin and surrounding normal tissue. </span></span></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em"><span class="mol-style-bold"><span class="mol-style-bold">They can destroy large parts of the skin and underlying tissue, and leave significant scarring.</span></span></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em"><span class="mol-style-bold"><span class="mol-style-bold">It is illegal to buy or sell the treatment in Australia. </span></span></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em;"><span class="mol-style-bold"><span class="mol-style-bold">Source:</span></span> <a style="font-weight: bold;" target="_blank" class="" rel="nofollow" href="https://www.tga.gov.au/alert/black-and-red-salves-treating-cancer"><span class="mol-style-bold">TGA</span></a></font></p>
                            </div>
                        </div><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'There was a bit of a crater after it fell out - there's not much flesh in that area. It's all fine. I have nothing there, I'm healthy. I had a blood test and it was all clear,' she said.  </font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em"></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">It comes after a Brisbane man created an inch-wide hole in his head after using an alternate treatment thought to be black salve to treat a lesion.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">The 55-year-old man presented to Princess Alexandra Emergency Department in Brisbane after applying the unlicensed treatment to his face for four months.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">His case appeared in the Medical Journal of Australia where doctors, Natalie Ong, Eric Sham and Brandon Adams, wrote that black salve could lead to scarring and disfigurement because it often contained an alkaloid from bloodroot and zinc chloride.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'In the absence of a biopsy, some patients may commence alternative treatment before attaining a diagnosis of skin cancer, and a very real risk of recurrence and metastasis (cancer spreading) remains,' the doctors wrote.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'As a consequence, there may be delays in diagnosis, and it may be difficult to identify the primary site of malignancy.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'It is imperative for health professionals to recognise that these unlicensed products may lead to adverse outcomes, and for consumers to realise that alternative therapies that have been described as natural are not necessarily safe or, by any standard, risk free.'</font></p><div class="moduleFull mol-video"><a name="video" class="namedLink"></a><div class="item">

</div></div><div class="clear"></div><p class="imageCaption">Ms Hollows said there was a little crater when the growth fell out and that her self-diagnosed treatment took about six weeks</p></div><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-6a7420fe7529e9" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B1A9300000578-3439933-image-a-64_1455077246199.jpg" style="display: none" height="357" width="634" alt="Ms Hollows took the last photo documenting the process a few weeks ago and says she is in the all clear" class="blkBorder img-share"/>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">Ms Hollows took the last photo documenting the process a few weeks ago and says she is in the all clear</p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em"></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">In Australia, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) continues to condemn the ointments. </font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">It is illegal to buy or sell the treatment in Australia because all therapeutic goods supplied  must be included in Australian Register of Therapeutic Goods.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">The TGA says it is ‘unaware of any credible, scientific evidence that black salve, red salve or cansema can cure or treat cancer.’</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'In addition there is no evidence that these products can be used to diagnose cancers. In fact, the evidence shows that they will cause skin irritation regardless of whether any malignancy is present,' the TGA said. </font></p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-87ba3c02d1bf1105" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/08/310BE67800000578-3439933-image-m-13_1455091532346.jpg" style="display: none" height="994" width="634" alt="After: The scar on Brita Hollows skin is barely visible " class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    <noscript>
      <img id="i-87ba3c02d1bf1105" src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/08/310BE67800000578-3439933-image-m-13_1455091532346.jpg" height="994" width="634" alt="After: The scar on Brita Hollows skin is barely visible " class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    </noscript>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">After: The scar on Brita Hollows skin is barely visible </p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">'Black and red salves and cansema are corrosive salves. They essentially burn off layers of the skin and surrounding normal tissue. They can destroy large parts of the skin and underlying tissue, and leave significant scarring.'  </font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">In response to online backlash, Ms Hollows said she was not promoting the use of black salve, rather she was giving an insight into how it worked for her.</font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em"></font></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"></p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><font style="font-size:1.2em">She urged people to seek help from a medical professional to determine what action needed to be taken before deciding on alternate treatment. </font></p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">    <div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-345fa56950985a88" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B22B000000578-3439933-image-a-69_1455077345233.jpg" style="display: none" height="421" width="634" alt="It comes after a Brisbane man created an inch-wide hole in his head after using an alternate treatment thought to be black salve to treat a lesion for four months" class="blkBorder img-share"/>

      <img id="i-345fa56950985a88" src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B22B000000578-3439933-image-a-69_1455077345233.jpg" height="421" width="634" alt="It comes after a Brisbane man created an inch-wide hole in his head after using an alternate treatment thought to be black salve to treat a lesion for four months" class="blkBorder img-share"/>
    </noscript>

</div>    <p class="imageCaption">It comes after a Brisbane man created an inch-wide hole in his head after using an alternate treatment thought to be black salve to treat a lesion for four months</p></div><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group"><div class="splitLeft"><div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-183e3a687be56e22" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B22A300000578-3439933-image-m-70_1455077351163.jpg" style="display: none" height="268" width="306" alt="" class="blkBorder img-share"/>

    </noscript>

</div></div><div class="splitRight"><div class="mol-img">
    <img id="i-f22e3bb30d25a189" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2016/02/10/04/310B22A800000578-3439933-image-a-71_1455077358167.jpg" style="display: none" height="268" width="306" alt="" class="blkBorder img-share"/>

<script type="text/javascript">
    DM.later('bundle', function(){
        var n = 0;
        var taboola_every_n = 10;
        var taboola_counter = 0;

        var addTaboola = function (node){
            var id = "taboola-stream-thumbnails-" + (++n);
            var taboola_node = '<div id="' + id + '" style="min-height: 280px;"></div>';
            $(node).before(taboola_node);

            window._taboola = window._taboola || [];
            _taboola.push({
                mode: 'thumbnails-b',
                container: id,
                placement: "Stream Thumbnails " + n});
        };

        DM.has('infinite-list', 'InfiniteList', {
url: '/api/infinite-list.html?channelShortName=news&pageSize=10',
            total: 13.0,
            from: 0,
            onAfterAppend: function (container){
                var items = $(container).children('div');
                if(!taboola_every_n){
                    return;
                }

                items.each(function (){
                    if (taboola_counter == 0){
                        addTaboola(this);
                        taboola_counter = taboola_every_n - 1;
                    }
                    else {
                        taboola_counter--;
                    }
                });
            }
        });
    });
</script>
